_header: I Thee honour with all my might / In form of bread as I Thee see
Versification: — four-line — abab with all b-rhymes rhyming with each other
_description: A prayer at the ‘leuacion’ — five quatrains

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
I þe honoure wiþ al my mihtIn fourme of Bred as i þe
                    se…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Wiþ ffadur and sone and holygostÞat Regneþ God
                    In Trinite. Amen.

                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

OxfBal316A.First Lines:
i the honour with al mightInforme of brede as y þe
                    seeIhesu þat of þat lady bryghtMary man be cam for
                    me…
OxfBal316A.Last Lines:
…That he þat mannes soule sleetheNeuer haue power of
                    me
OxfBal316A.Note:
Added by original scribe to last folio of volume, to fill out
                    quire.
OxfBal316A.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Private Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Studies in Philology
         36 (1939): 466-75: 472-3.

OxfChrCh151.First Lines:
In the honour with all myghtIn forme of brede as y þe
                    see…
OxfChrCh151.Last Lines:
…That he þat mannes sowle sleethNeuer haue power on
                    me
OxfChrCh151.Note: Last item in the manuscript (MS has no foliation).

BLAdd37787.First Lines:
Welcome be þu soule fodeBoþe Jhesu god and manneffor
                    me þu honge apon þe roodeÞe bodi blike ande wonneThe
                    water & þe blod out of þi side ronOf my sinnes lorde do me
                    boteIhesus god and monGraunte me þat I þe loue moteI
                    þe honour with al my myht…
BLAdd37787.Last Lines:
…ffadur & son and holigostThat regneþ god in
                    trinite
BLAdd37787.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Levation Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         40 (1942): 131-46: 138-9.
Baugh,  Nita Scudder. 
             A Worcestershire Miscellany, compiled by John
                    Northwood, c. 1400, edited from British Museum MS. Add.
                37,787.
         Philadelphia, 1956: 97-100.

Lam559.First Lines:
Lorde I the honoure with all my myghtIn forme of bred as i the
                    seeIhesu that in mari hym lythAnd man bi come for loue of
                    me…
Lam559.Last Lines:
…And through that ladi of mercie mostmi soule thou take to
                    theTo thi mercie I triste as þow wel wostNow gracius god graunte
                    it me. Amen
Lam559.Attributed Title: This prayer schal be said at agnus dei (f. 32, rubric)

PhilUPEng2.First Lines:
I The honour with al my myȝtin forme of brede as y þee
                    see…
PhilUPEng2.Last Lines:
…That he þat mannes soule sleetheneuere haue power of
                    me
